Articles.Content:
Using my own mod Warships (soon on KerbalStuff.com) I'm building my own [s]battlecruiser[/s] battleship in WW2 tradition. Weapons mods are BDArmory and Naval Guns.

It's a bit of a blend between the Missouri and the Bismarck.
Deck guns not yet installed.
Length: 260m.
Beam: 28m.
Draft: to be determined after completion.
Height: 28m.
Tonnage at this time: 8000.
Fuel tanks: 228t.
Boilers: 4.
Electrical Generators: 4.
Turbines: 4.

"WW2 Warships 0.1" will be launched after the weekend, I'll include a simple tutorial to get people on their way.

And I challenge you for a future contest (after 1.1 has arrived).

Weaponry will be 4 38cm dual turrets, 40mm Bofors, radar, AA guns, forward and aft torpedo launchers.

[imgur]2mmAh[/imgur] Edited November 20, 2015 by Azimech
That is one large craft. Interested to see how this one turns out.
Wow that's looking like a beast! I'm sure it will be able to take quite a few hits!
That's awesome. I think I need to go build a new Battleship now.
For more information about the Warships mod, [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/139625-Warships-0-1-They-really-sink"]look here.[/URL]

Wow, literally JUST as i saw this i was testing out this behemoth.. The Mk3 parts are actually really good for boats :)

[IMG]http://imgur.com/PoVY7gi.jpg[/IMG]
[SIZE=4]Great WIP craft though! :), love the boiler mod idea :)[/SIZE]

Yeah, MK3 parts are nice ... have you seen my cargo ship?

[IMGUR]3no9O[/IMGUR]
A yea, i had seen that before, but it is pretty amazing still :)

Working on a pt boat, that battle cruiser is just going to crush it :P I'm working on a Fubuki or a Shimakaze after that. I'm wondering what the part counts for the ships will be... I actually used 2/3 open Mk2 Cargo bays for PT Boats, Mk3 is just a bit to big for it!
Updated the OP, you might like this!
